sizes.name: Village
sizes.description: A small settlement surrounded by farmland. Most villagers are commoners who farm the land or make simple goods.

sizes.name: Town
sizes.description: A busy settlement with defined streets, a marketplace, and some fortifications. Towns often serve as hubs for surrounding villages.

sizes.name: City
sizes.description: A large, walled settlement with defined districts, multiple temples, and a variety of shops and services. Cities are centers of trade, culture, and governance.

sizes.name: Metropolis
sizes.description: A sprawling urban center with tens of thousands of inhabitants. Metropolises are seats of power, home to guilds, academies, and every service imaginable.

governmentTypes.name: Autocracy
governmentTypes.description: One individual holds absolute authority. Typically a king, queen, warlord, or other ruler.

governmentTypes.name: Bureaucracy
governmentTypes.description: Various departments compose the government, each responsible for an aspect of rule.

governmentTypes.name: Confederacy
governmentTypes.description: Multiple allied settlements share governance through representatives.

governmentTypes.name: Democracy
governmentTypes.description: Citizens vote on issues or elect representatives to make decisions.

governmentTypes.name: Dictatorship
governmentTypes.description: One individual rules by force, having seized power through military strength or political maneuvering.

governmentTypes.name: Feudalism
governmentTypes.description: A lord or noble owns the land and grants fiefs to vassals, who provide military service and tribute.

governmentTypes.name: Gerontocracy
governmentTypes.description: A council of elders rules, typically the oldest and wisest members of the community.

governmentTypes.name: Hierarchy
governmentTypes.description: A structured chain of command runs from a supreme authority down through layers of subordinates.

governmentTypes.name: Magocracy
governmentTypes.description: Spellcasters rule, using magical power as the basis of authority.

governmentTypes.name: Matriarchy/Patriarchy
governmentTypes.description: The eldest or most prominent member of one gender holds authority.

governmentTypes.name: Militocracy
governmentTypes.description: The highest-ranking military officer holds power, and the government is run like an army.

governmentTypes.name: Monarchy
governmentTypes.description: A hereditary ruler, typically a king or queen, holds authority that passes through bloodlines.

governmentTypes.name: Oligarchy
governmentTypes.description: A small group of powerful figures rules, such as nobles, merchants, or guild leaders.

governmentTypes.name: Plutocracy
governmentTypes.description: The wealthiest citizens rule, with power derived from commercial success.

governmentTypes.name: Republic
governmentTypes.description: The people elect representatives who make governing decisions on their behalf.

governmentTypes.name: Theocracy
governmentTypes.description: Religious leaders hold power, claiming divine authority. Laws are based on religious doctrine.
